member.name: T:XSharp.RDD.DBF
member.summary: DBF RDD. Usually not used 'stand alone'

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.AddField(XSharp.RDD.Support.RddFieldInfo)
member.summary: Add a column.
member.param: RddFieldInfo object.

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.Append(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Append a blank row and position the cursor to the new row.
member.param: A flag that is TRUE if you want to clear all pending row locks before appending the new row and FALSE if you want to add the new row to the end of the current lock list.

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.summary: Add a newly appended row to the list of locked rows.
member.param: An enum value specifying the kind of lock to acquire.

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.FieldIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Return the ONE based field index for a field name.
member.param: The name of the field in the database file structure. When the name is not found it will also check for a field alias with this name.
member.returns: The ONE based position of the field in the database file structure.

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.FieldInfo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieve and optionally change information about a column.
member.param: The ONE based position of the field in the database file structure.
Specifies the type of information.
If specified (not null), then this parameter is used to change the value of a setting.
member.returns: The current value for the property indicated with <nOrdinal>

member.summary: Retrieve a column name based on its ONE based column number.

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.Skip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Position the cursor relative to its current position.
member.param: The number of rows to skip. If this argument is positive, the cursor moves forward (toward the end-of-file). If it is negative, the cursor moves backward (toward the beginning-of-file).

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.SkipFilter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Position the cursor, respecting scope and filter conditions.
member.param: The number of rows to skip. If this argument is positive, the cursor moves forward (toward the end-of-file). If it is negative, the cursor moves backward (toward the beginning-of-file).

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.SkipRaw(System.Int32)
member.summary: Position the cursor regardless of scope and filter conditions.
member.param: The number of rows to skip. If this argument is positive, the cursor moves forward (toward the end-of-file). If it is negative, the cursor moves backward (toward the beginning-of-file).

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.SkipScope(System.Int32)
member.summary: Position the cursor relative to its current position within the current scope.
member.param: The number of rows to skip. If this argument is positive, the cursor moves forward (toward the end-of-file). If it is negative, the cursor moves backward (toward the beginning-of-file).

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: M:XSharp.RDD.DBF.UnLock(System.Object)
member.summary: Release locks.
member.param: The row number to unlock. This argument is provided for drivers that support multiple row locks. By convention, a value of zero indicates that all rows should be unlocked.

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.summary: Physically remove all rows from a table.

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.summary: Read (Import) a value from an external file and write it to the specified column.
member.param: ONE based position for which the value should be written.
Name of the file that needs to be read from.

returns.span:
TRUE when the operation succeeded or FALSE when the operation failed.
Some RDD operations do not really return FALSE but throw an exception to indicate failure.
These exceptions are caught in the higher level code and registered in the LastRddError property in the runtime state..

member.name: P:XSharp.RDD.DbfHeader.Year
member.summary: Year of last update YY is added to a base of 1900 decimal to determine the actual year. Therefore, YY has possible values from 0x00-0xFF, which allows for a range from 1900-2155.
